resourcemanager

Class ResourceLookupTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • resourcemanager.ResourceLookupTable

  • public class ResourceLookupTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Lookup table used primarily by a resource graph which allows hashed search by name.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceLookupTable()
      ResourceLookupTable's constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addName(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String name)
      Adds a name to the dynamic name array.
      void addNode(java.lang.Integer id, ResourceNode node)
      Add a node to the table's array of nodes.
      void addSlotActiveState(java.lang.Integer id, boolean as)
      Adds an entry to the active state array for this table.
      void addSlotReferencedState(java.lang.Integer id)
      Adds an "unchecked" state entry to the referenced state array for this table.
      void addSlotUsableState(java.lang.Integer id)
      Adds an "unchecked" state entry to the usable state array for this table.
      void clear()
      Clears the graph of all entries; reduces size to zero.
      java.lang.Integer lookupId(java.lang.String name)
      Retrieves the ID corresponding to a resource name by using a hash table.
      java.lang.Integer nextId()
      Gets the next available ID in the graph
      java.lang.Integer put(java.lang.String name)
      Puts a resource onto the lookup table
      void remove(java.lang.String rname)
      Deactivates a resource from the graph without fully deleting it.
      void resetReferencedStates()
      Sets all referenced states in the table back to "unchecked".
      void resetUsableStates()
      Sets all usable states in the table back to "unchecked".
      void restore(java.lang.String rname)
      Restore a resource to the graph.
      int size()
      Gets the number of lookup entries in this table.

        public java.lang.Integer lookupId(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves the ID corresponding to a resource name by using a hash table.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource
        Returns:
        the ID of the node which has that name

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new resource
        Returns:
        the ID of the new (or pre-existing) resource

        public void remove(java.lang.String rname)
        Deactivates a resource from the graph without fully deleting it.
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Gets the number of lookup entries in this table.
